TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit SoapDateTime extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides static methods for the serialization and deserialization of to a string that is formatted as XSD .

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about XSD data types, see "XML Data Types Reference" in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the methods in the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDateTime> class to convert between a <xref:System.DateTime> object and an XSD `dateTime` string.
[!code-cpp[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDateTime#10](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDateTime/CPP/demo.cpp#10)] [!code-csharp[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDateTime#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDateTime/CS/demo.cs#10)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
.method public static hidebysig valuetype System.DateTime Parse(string value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts the specified into a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `Parse` method is capable of parsing strings in various formats. The recognizable string formats are composed out of the following format patterns.
|Format Pattern|Description|Examples| |--------------------|-----------------|--------------| |yyyy|The year in 4-digit format.|1999, 1812| |MM|The numeric month. Single-digit months have a leading zero.|11, 05| |dd|The day of the month. Single-digit days have a leading zero.|23, 09| |HH|The hour within a 24-hour range. Single-digit hours have a leading zero.|17, 07| |mm|The minute. Single-digit minutes have a leading zero.|49, 05| |ss|The second. Single-digit seconds have a leading zero.|32, 02| |f, ff, fff, ..., ffffffffff|The fraction of a second. The number of 'f' characters in the pattern indicates the number of fraction digits.|321635, 4592| |zzz|The full time zone offset (hour and minutes) from the Universal Time Coordinate (Greenwich Mean Time). Single-digit hours have a leading zero.|-07:00, 08:00|
## Examples The following code example shows how to use this method. This code example is part of a larger example that is provided for the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDateTime> class.
[!code-cpp[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDateTime#11](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDateTime/CPP/demo.cpp#11)] [!code-csharp[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDateTime#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapDateTime/CS/demo.cs#11)]

Docs.exception:
One of the following:
- is an empty string.
- is reference.
- does not contain a date and time that corresponds to any of the recognized format patterns.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string ToString(valuetype System.DateTime value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the specified object as a .
Docs.returns: A representation of in the format "yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.fffffffzzz".

Docs.summary: Gets the XML Schema definition language (XSD) of the current SOAP type.
Docs.value: A that indicates the XSD of the current SOAP type.
